1.text: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it comes from the desert, from a terrible land.

2.text: A grievous vision is declared to me; the treacherous dealer deals treacherously, and the spoiler spoils. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.

3.text: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold on me, as the pangs of a woman that travails: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.

4.text: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure has he turned into fear to me.

5.text: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, you princes, and anoint the shield.

6.text: For thus has the LORD said to me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he sees.

7.text: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he listened diligently with much heed:

8.text: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:

9.text: And, behold, here comes a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he has broken to the ground.

10.text: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared to you.

11.text: The burden of Dumah. He calls to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?

12.text: The watchman said, The morning comes, and also the night: if you will inquire, inquire you: return, come.

13.text: The burden on Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall you lodge, O you traveling companies of Dedanim.

14.text: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.

15.text: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.

16.text: For thus has the LORD said to me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:

17.text: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the LORD God of Israel has spoken it.
